shortdesc.ph: Determines whether to receive audio data from multiple channels.

section.p: After you register the audio frame observer, the SDK triggers this callback every time it captures an audio frame.

In the multi-channel scenario, if you want to get audio data from multiple channels, set the return value of this callback as true. After successful setting, the SDK will trigger a callback to send you the received audio frame before mixing and report which channel the audio frame comes from.

ul.li: Once you set the return value of the callback to, the SDK will only trigger to return the received audio data before mixing. Will not be triggered. In the multi-channel scenario, Agora recommends setting the return value as true.
If you set the return value of this callback as false, the SDK triggers only the `onRenderVideoFrame` callback to send the video data.
`true`: Receive audio data from multiple channels.
`false`: Do not receive audio data from multiple channels.
